section.para:

setupwiz.opt
setup wizard setupwiz.opt

It is also possible to specify options on the command-line, though this is a bit intricated. You have to stick to the following
setup wizard command-line options
syntax:

section.title: Directories
section.para: The standard installation procedure creates up to four directories:

listitem.para:
The installation directory contains the installed files of the &MiKTeX; distribution.
installation directory defined
The default directory location is &installdir;.

The user configuration directory
user configuration directory defined
contains user-specific configuration files. The default directory location is &userconfigdir;.

The user data directory
user data directory defined
contains user-specific data files. The default directory location is &userdatadir;.

The common configuration & data directory
common configuration directory defined
common data directory defined
contains common configuration and data files. The default directory location is &commondatadir;.

section.para: It is possible to integrate additional directories into a &MiKTeX; setup. For example, users often want to maintain a separate directory with their own style files. See , for more information how to manage this.

section.title: Removing &MiKTeX;
section.para:
